summary:
Engaged leader, passionate about using her strong technical background and experience leading through challenging situations, to serve, support, and develop the careers of the scientists on her team to bring novel biotherapeutics to patients. Excels at working in collaborative environments with internal development and quality partners. Experienced in interactions with FDA and foreign health authority representatives through multiple pre- and post-approval audits.

Detail-oriented, data-driven with over a decade and a half of industry experience working with a variety of biotherapeutic modalities – mAbs, ADCs, vaccines, and gene therapies. Skilled in a spectrum of bioanalytical techniques for GMP and R&D testing.

educations.schoolName: The Johns Hopkins University - Carey Business School

headline: Senior Manager, Analytical Operations at Novartis | MBA candidate at The Johns Hopkins University Carey Business School

message.text: An exciting opportunity to join the Novartis radioligand org in North county San Diego

ingestedContentSummary.title: Commissioning & Qualification (C&Q) Engineering Lead (RLT, Carlsbad)

message.text:
Hi everyone! I’m looking to hire a great individual to help lead our C&Q activities for a new site buildout in Carlsbad, CA. Know anyone that might be interested?

Matt Casey

Hello LinkedIn friends & colleagues!

I don't post much on social media platforms, so you may not know I've been working toward my MBA at Johns Hopkins Carey Business School. This semester I'm taking a discovery to market class and my team is working on a real-world invention in cancer immunotherapy. Would anyone in the LinkedIn community be willing to lend their expertise to help my team with our group project?

My team is analyzing the potential of an early-stage oncology therapy from the NIH and, therefore, helping the inventors determine if it can be commercialized. The therapy would target melanoma, pancreatic, and other gastrointestinal cancers.
 
We need to conduct interviews with the following individuals:

•Caregivers, family members of patients
•Community groups, patient advocacy groups
•Clinical care providers (MD/DOs, Pharmacists, other HCPs, etc.)
•Purchasing decision-makers (e.g., from hospitals, pharmacy benefit managers, etc.)
•Payers (e.g., commercial, CMS)
•Regulators, government agencies (e.g., FDA, Consultants)
•Investors (e.g., Venture capital partners, Pharma business development groups)
 
We want to conduct the interviews as soon as possible. Please reach out if you are willing to be interviewed, even for 10-15 minutes.

Thank you so much for your time and help,
Stef
